entries.title: Muk's Guide to Everything he Learned From Tasha
entries.altText: Muk's Guide to Everything he Learned From Tasha

entries: An adventure activity book for players of all levels

entries.name: In Support of Extra Life
entries: Created & Illustrated by Emi Tanji
Adventure & Design Genius by Adam Lee and Chris Lindsay
Special Thanks to Bart Carroll and Brandy Camel

entries.title: Hello! Muk and {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM}, here!
entries.altText: Hello! Muk and Birdsquirrel, here! Notice anything new? Me, Muk! The goblin! My best friend, Birdsquirrel! There's a special visitor in the Dankwood today and we'd like you to meet her...

entries.title: Tasha the Witch
entries.altText: Tasha the Witch

entries.title: Give everyone a witch hat
entries.altText: Give everyone a witch hat. Muk. Birdsquirrel. Tasha. Mordenkainen (He's not a witch, but Tasha says he wishes he were.) Yeti Tyke (If a Yeti Tyke wants to be a witch... let them!

entries.title: Tasha has traveled to many lands, and has met some fantastic creatures!
entries.altText: Tasha has traveled to many lands, and has met some fantastic creatures! A Kobold Artificer and her baby toucan homunculus servant, most kobolds are totally obsessed with dragons! A Tabaxi Swarmkeeper who cares for colorful dragonflies, Tabaxis like shiny things. A kind Firbolg Circle of Spores Druid.

entries.title: Raiding Tasha's Closet!
entries.altText: Raiding Tasha's Closet! What wondrous outfits! The Robe of Eyes lets you see in all directions! Let those grungs try to sneak up on me now!

entries.title: What does YOUR magical spellcaster look like?
entries.altText: What does YOUR magical spellcaster look like? Your name. Magical item(s).

entries.title: What's in Tasha's Cauldron?
entries.altText: What's in Tasha's Cauldron? What do you think belongs in Tasha's bubbling cauldron? Ingredients, Two rotting: A pinch of: Two cups of: A handful of:

entries: A spell {@b COMPONENT} is what you need to cast a spell.
But they're not always items!
Sometimes it is a magical phrase or gesture.
What are some ingredients you might use for a spell?

items.name: Verbal (V):
entries: Magical words that can be spoken, chanted or sung in a particular way.

items.name: Somatic (S):
entries: Physical movements like waving your hands or wiggling your nose.

items.name: Material (M):
entries: Particular objects that are needed to cast your spell.

entries.title: Some items you might find in the Dankwood
entries.altText: Some items you might find in the Dankwood. Stinky gray slaad toenail clippings. A glass jar with a single napping honeybee inside. Definitely a magical snake stick. Clumps of gross, gooey spiderfrog webs. Hey! #1 DumDum, Mystery brew from the Dum-Dum Goblin village. An expensive elven scroll that was stolen found. The Shiniest Rock. That's MY shiny rock. Family of singing mushrooms. An owlbear feather. A torn and mysterious fortune. "A black wind howls."

entries.title: Our last ingredient is: Fruit from the Winnieberry Tree
entries.altText: Our last ingredient is: Fruit from the Winnieberry Tree. But first get past the grumpy grungs! They're similar in size to us goblins! Why so cranky?!

entries.name: Can you spot the difference?
entries: Find {@b 10} differences between these two pictures!

entries.title: {@b Rough River} ahead!
entries.altText: Rough River ahead!

entries: Help our adventurers choose the right route to get to {@b safety!}
Use the whirlpool arrows to move Muk's boat faster down the river.
They can navigate around rocks, logs and bumpy water. But if they hit a monster (shown with an {@b X}), it'll be a very soggy trip.

entries.name: The winnieberry tree! We made it!
entries: Watch out for the {@creature vargouille|VGM|Vargouilles}!
Tiny weirdos who fly around with {@b bat-like} wings where their ears should be! Yuck!
Which tree branch should Muk climb that will give him the MOST fruit?
Hurry, the {@creature vargouille|VGM|vargouilles} are starting to swarm!

entries.title: Having a {@b sidekick} like {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM} is the best!

entries: We've been inseparable since the day I was born!
Thank you for pulling me from the Rough River!
I like you kid, you might smell funny but I'll show you the way out of this maze.
I love picking locks! And sneaking. And treasure. Let me come along!

entries.title: Sidekicks can be age old friends...ones we call family...or those we've just met!
entries.altText: Sidekicks can be age old friends...ones we call family...or those we've just met!

entries.title: How to draw a SIDEKICK
entries.altText: How to draw a SIDEKICK. Yeti Tyke, Almiraj, Kobold. Now you try! Write a note to your sidekick! Ask an adult if you need help cutting out the letter.

entries.title: Thank you sidekick
entries.altText: Thank you sidekick. My Sidekick's Name. Picture of my Sidekick. How we first met. My favourite things about my sidekick. Signed:

entries.title: A spell no one's heard of is just a spell that's yet to be discovered!
entries.altText: A spell no one's heard of is just a spell that's yet to be discovered!

entries.name: Fun Fact
entries: {@creature Tasha the Witch|VEoR|Tasha} is adopted. She was raised by the famous witch, Baba Yaga, who lives in a hut that sits on giant chicken legs!
Help Muk choose just the right words to describe his adventure with Tasha!

entries.title: Arcana Check!
entries.altText: Arcana Check!

items.name: Instructions
entries: Once you've finished choosing your words, flip to the next page and fill in the blanks in the order as it's listed. What type of spell has Muk discovered?

items.name: Adjective:
entries: A word that {@i describes} something or someone

items.name: Adverb:
entries: A verb (action) usually ending in "ly"

items.name: Noun:
entries: A person, place or thing

items.name: Plural Noun:
entries: Multiple persons, places or things

items.name: Verb:
entries: Ab action, or something someone does

I was a bit {@footnote _______________|ADJECTIVE} when Tasha first {@footnote _______________|VERB, PAST TENSE} in to the Dankwood. She's so {@footnote _______________|ADJECTIVE} and meeting her for the first time made our {@footnote _______________|PART OF THE BODY (PLURAL)} {@footnote _______________|VERB}!

Tasha's most famous spell is called {@spell Tasha's hideous laughter}. With her help, I was able to create my very own spell: Muk's {@footnote _______________|ADJECTIVE} {@footnote _______________|NOUN}. It is pretty advanced and requires the following components: {@footnote _______________|NUMBER} winnieberries, a handful of {@footnote _______________|ADJECTIVE} {@footnote _______________|PLURAL NOUN}, two {@footnote _______________|COLOR} {@footnote _______________|PLURAL NOUN} the size of a {@footnote _______________|NOUN}. Combine them together in a large {@footnote _______________|TYPE OF CONTAINER} and sing, "Oh {@footnote _______________|PERSON IN ROOM}, lend me your {@footnote _______________|NOUN}!"
Enjoy my magical spell!
Check out page 40 for instructions on how to make your own, mini spellbook!
Spells come from the caster and can be influenced by their personality or traits! What do your spells look like? Smell like?

entries.title: Muk's {@spell Shield of Faith} spell appears as a giant, spectral {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM}, ready to protect!
entries.altText: Muk's Shield of Faith spell appears as a giant, spectral Birdsquirrel, ready to protect!

entries.title: {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM} STILL can't read so good... can you please help?
entries.altText: Birdsquirrel STILL can't read so good... can you please help?

entries.title: Crossword Puzzle
entries.altText: Crossword Puzzle

entries.name: Down
items: 1. A small and clever reptilian creature. They are known to worship dragons.
2. Tasha grew up in a hut that stood on this animal's legs.
3. {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM|Birdsquirrel's} best friend.
5. Something you need in order to cast a spell.
6. Vargouilles have this animal's wings sprouting from their heads.

entries.name: Across
items: 4. Someone who helps you on your adventures.
7. A baby yeti is called this.
8. The name of this famous spell: {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter||Tasha's Hideous ___________}.

entries.title: Read on for more adventure and sidekick ideas!
entries.altText: Read on for more adventure and sidekick ideas!

entries.name: Adventure Ideas
entries: Every adventure in the Dankwood has a solution that can be attained without resorting to combat. Goblins can sneak out of danger, they can act all tough and bluff their way through a problem, and they are also known to be able to make friends with just about anybody (even {@creature Dankwood Grung|MGELFT|grumpy grung}!).

Read over the adventure hooks to get an idea of the problem or mystery and then check out the questions. These questions are prompts to let your players invent their own creative ways to solve the adventure and tell their own Dankwood story. There are infinite possible paths as to how each story can be told, so let your imagination lead the way!

entries.name: Tasha's Party
entries: Tasha needs your help! She wants to throw a party and make her super special Green Bubble soup. Everyone in Gob-Town is excited but Tasha says to make Green Bubble soup she needs some gooey webs from the rare and elusive {@creature spiderfrog|MGELFT}. Do you know where to get some for her?

You've heard that the {@creature King Robbit the Slimy|MGELFT|grung king, Robbit the Slimy}, might know where to get some—or he and {@creature Dankwood Grung|MGELFT|his grungs} may even have some webs to trade.

items: What does {@creature King Robbit the Slimy|MGELFT|King Robbit} want in exchange for information about the location of the {@creature spiderfrog|MGELFT|spiderfrogs} or (if he has them) for the webs? If you can find out what he likes, then you might be able to trade with him.

If the {@creature Dankwood Grung|MGELFT|grung} are too grumpy, then who would know where to find {@creature spiderfrog|MGELFT} webs in the Dankwood? Who would you need to ask to get this information? There are a ton of goblin friends who know stuff!

entries.name: Ask Around Gob-Town! Find Stuff Out!
entries: {@creature King Robbit the Slimy|MGELFT|King Robbit} is shrewd and {@creature Dankwood Grung|MGELFT|grungs} are super grumpy. It's not going to be easy to get {@creature spiderfrog|MGELFT|spiderfrog} webs from them.
Tasha knows that {@creature spiderfrog|MGELFT|spiderfrogs} spin their webs next to clear, still ponds that reflect the moonlight. They also make a high-pitched squeaking sound during the full moon.

entries.name: The Lost Yeti
entries: While wandering around the Dankwood, you found a {@creature yeti tyke|MGELFT}. It's a mopey little critter but it's probably because it just misses its family.
You're pretty sure that its family lives in the Snowy Hills to the north. It's a long trip but if this {@creature yeti tyke|MGELFT|tyke} is going to get back home, someone has to show it the way.

entries.name: The Real Story!
entries: The yeti tyke was separated from its parents by a group of {@creature Dankwood Duergar|MGELFT|grumpy duergar}. The yetis live in a cave, but that cave contains a secret door that leads to an underground labyrinth that has an ancient treasure hidden within it. The yetis didn't know about the secret door or the treasure but the {@creature Dankwood Duergar|MGELFT|duergar} sure did and they chased them out of the cave so they could hunt for the loot.

When the heroes return the {@creature yeti tyke|MGELFT|tyke} to its parents, the yetis tell them about the {@creature Dankwood Duergar|MGELFT|grumpy duergar} and how they've been chased out of their home. Can our heroes help get the yetis back in their home, give the duergar the boot, and maybe get some of that treasure the duergar are looking for?

items: Can anyone speak {@language yeti|MM}? Maybe Tasha has a spell or a potion for that!

What are some possible ways to get rid of the {@creature Dankwood Duergar|MGELFT|duergar}? Some people who know about them say that {@creature Dankwood Duergar|MGELFT|duergar} are terrified of mind flayers—maybe the heroes could dress up like them and scare the {@creature Dankwood Duergar|MGELFT|duergar} away?

The yetis say that there is a super scary monster called a {@creature remorhaz} living nearby. Maybe that monster could come in handy when dealing with the {@creature Dankwood Duergar|MGELFT|duergar}? It's risky!
Do the {@creature Dankwood Duergar|MGELFT|duergar} have a map? That labyrinth sure is confusing and it could be easy to get lost in there!

entries.name: The Cursed Spring
entries: The heroes come across a {@creature pixie} who is crying by a spring that is all filled with stinky muck and bubbling sludge. If they ask what is wrong, she tells them that her beautiful spring has been cursed by an evil {@creature sludge hag|MGELFT} that has moved into the Dankwood. She asks if the heroes can help get the hag to remove the spring's curse.

items: Can the {@creature sludge hag|MGELFT|hag} be bargained with? Everyone has something that they covet or crave, maybe there's a way to find out what this {@creature sludge hag|MGELFT|hag} desires above everything else.
Can you make friends with the {@creature sludge hag|MGELFT|hag}? Maybe no one has ever treated the {@creature sludge hag|MGELFT|hag} with kindness—a fresh baked pie might do the trick!
Can the {@creature sludge hag|MGELFT|hag} be tricked? Maybe they're a sucker for taking bets and, if you're good enough, you can beat them in a game of chance.
Can you use your friends to help? Your friend, Tasha, is a pretty powerful witch. Maybe she knows something about the {@creature sludge hag|MGELFT|hag's} weakness that you can take advantage of.

entries.name: More Adventure Hooks!
entries: Here's a list of fun ideas that can inspire a fun story in the Dankwood. Use them to spawn more adventures!

entries.caption: Dankwood Adventure Hooks
rows: A flute, that when played, summons a {@creature pegasus}. (Where does the {@creature pegasus} fly to if you get on its back?)
A carved wooden bird that comes to life when picked up and leads the adventurers to the entrance of a cave. (What treasures are in the cave?)
A {@creature pixie} flies up to you and asks if you would help to chase a {@creature troll} away from its village. (How do you get rid of a dangerous troll?)
A hunter is in the forest looking for a rare elk with golden antlers. (Either help the hunter catch the elk or help the elk escape the hunter.)

An elf who claims to be of royal blood is seeking refuge in the Dankwood. He is being hunted by rival elves and is willing to pay gold for your help. (Is the elf really who he says he is? Who are the rival elves?)
A gnome rushes up to you, hands you a golden key, and tells you, "Find the crystal cave and save me." before turning to stone!
One of your nets traps a {@creature tiger}. As you are figuring out what to do with it, the {@creature tiger} speaks and claims that it was once a halfling that was cursed by an evil wizard.
A bounty hunter is on the lookout for a criminal. Is the criminal actually bad or is the bounty hunter bad?

entries.name: Monsters
entries: The following monsters have been simplified/modified to be used in Muk's Adventures. The following stat blocks are for your reference. Feel free to adjust or add in whatever you'd like to customize it to your story.

entries.altText: My treasure! Stony gray skin. White Hair.

items.name: Winky-Bix
entries: {@i Small Dankwood Almiraj}
Winky-Bix is the first to help in times of need. They can cast the cantrip {@spell Light}, once every long rest.

entries.name: Personality:
entries: I may be tiny, but I'm always willing to give it my all!

entries.name: Flaw:
entries: My ears are extra soft and extra long–sometimes I trip over them.
{@skillCheck nature 2} to {@skill Nature} checks

items.name: Durdle
entries: {@i Small Awakened Turtle}
Durdle is always ready to help out with a slow spell he casts once per day.

entries.name: Personality:
entries: If you take your time, you'll do it right.

entries.name: Flaw:
entries: Always late to parties.
{@skillCheck perception 2} to {@skill Perception} checks

items.name: Cole
entries: {@i Awakened Rock}
An awakened rock with a painted-on smiley face. Cole can fit in your pocket and will happily whisper positive thoughts throughout the day.

entries.name: Personality:
entries: You'll always have a friend in me!

entries.name: Flaw:
entries: My face sometimes gets rubbed off. I'll need help putting it back on, if you don't mind.
{@d20 3} to charisma checks

items.name: Pippy
entries: {@i Tiny Sprite}
Pippy is a fierce {@creature sprite} warrior who is a defender of the Dankwood. If Pippy is within 10 feet, you can't be {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Personality:
entries: I am afraid of no one!

entries.name: Flaw:
entries: I am afraid of no one!
{@hit 1} to attack rolls

entries.title: Be a Hero & Play D&D
entries.altText: Be a Hero & Play D&D. Extra Life.

entries.title: Mini Spellbook
entries.altText: Mini Spellbook

items: Fold in half lengthwise
Unfold, then fold in half widthwise
Unfold, then fold the edges up to the center
Your paper should have creases like these.
Fold in half widthwise and cut a slit half way to the {@color X|ee1c25}
Unfold, then fold lengthwise and push the ends in towards the center
Fold all pages together in to your mini spellbook!
Ta-da!

entries: Use the template on the next page for an extra magical look!
DOTTED LINE - FOLD
SOLID LINE - CUT

entries.title: I ❤️ Extra Life and owlbears
entries.altText: I ❤️ Extra Life and owlbears

entries: I might not look like you, and you might not look like me. But those wonderful differences, should be celebrated and seen.
{@style Thank you|large}
for joining Muk, {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM} and I on another adventure in the Dankwood–our world enriched by the spectacular talents of Adam Lee and Chris Lindsay.
Thank you to everyone, for your encouragement, support and time spent with us. Shared moments together are such incredible treasures.

We can accomplish so much together and I am grateful to see the kindness, laughter and support that is cultivated by the Dungeons & Dragons community. Let's be kind, let's do good and let's tell our stories together.
